It is a declarative language, which means that it is easy to write queries. However, it is also a flexible language, which means that it is easy to write queries that are not declarative. This guide will help you to write declarative queries. Until now, you have created a server that returns data. However, you have not used the data in any way. This guide will help you to use the data in a declarative way. GraphQL clients are used to send queries to a GraphQL server. Requests are sent in the form of a query string. The response is returned in the form of a JSON object. The response is a JSON object that contains the data that is requested. Request are made to a GraphQL server using HTTP protocol, so you can use the same client as a client for RESTful APIs."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-36c8d6cd-dfa9-4139-ac2c-4a61ef7d2979.mdx",lineNumber:13,columnNumber:1},this),(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.h1,{id:"getting-started",children:[(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.a,{href:"#getting-started","aria-hidden":"true",tabIndex:"-1",children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.span,{className:"icon icon-link"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-36c8d6cd-dfa9-4139-ac2c-4a61ef7d2979.mdx"},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-36c8d6cd-dfa9-4139-ac2c-4a61ef7d2979.mdx"},this),"Getting Started"]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-36c8d6cd-dfa9-4139-ac2c-4a61ef7d2979.mdx",lineNumber:16,columnNumber:1},this),(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.h2,{id:"graphql-ides",children:[(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.a,{href:"#graphql-ides","aria-hidden":"true",tabIndex:"-1",children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.span,{className:"icon icon-link"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-36c8d6cd-dfa9-4139-ac2c-4a61ef7d2979.mdx"},this)},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-36c8d6cd-dfa9-4139-ac2c-4a61ef7d2979.mdx"},this),"GraphQL IDE's"]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-36c8d6cd-dfa9-4139-ac2c-4a61ef7d2979.mdx",lineNumber:18,columnNumber:1},this),(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:["IDE's are test tools to check the correctness of your queries. It is a great GraphQL client, but it is not a good choice for simple applications and beginners. It is highly opinionated, users must follow the strict rules. The main thing here is that the error possibility is minimal. Contrary to other clients it misses a lot of flexibility. Relay demands a lot of knowledge about the application and schema design. The shiny point is that it is awesome for scalability. Relay is a complete framework for declarative data fetching. To be able to use Relay, one must create a GraphQL server compatible with Relay. Many developers avoid using Relay and instead use Apollo Client for complex applications, due to its simplicity and flexibility. It is hard to set up compared to other frameworks, but when everything is done, it is less error-prone and can be used in production serving a lot of users. The big advantage of React Relay is that it is supported by Facebook and is tested by millions of users on their social networks. In the new release of React18, the Suspense feature is deeply integrated with Relay. So, if you are using React for your application, with Relay you can get a great performance boost."},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-36c8d6cd-dfa9-4139-ac2c-4a61ef7d2979.mdx",lineNumber:506,columnNumber:1},this),(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:"From the official documentation:"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-36c8d6cd-dfa9-4139-ac2c-4a61ef7d2979.mdx",lineNumber:513,columnNumber:1},this),(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:"Relay is composed of three core parts:"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-36c8d6cd-dfa9-4139-ac2c-4a61ef7d2979.mdx",lineNumber:515,columnNumber:1},this),(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.blockquote,{children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.ul,{children:[(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.li,{children:[(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.em,{children:"Relay Compiler"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-36c8d6cd-dfa9-4139-ac2c-4a61ef7d2979.mdx",lineNumber:517,columnNumber:5},this),": A GraphQL to GraphQL optimizing compiler, providing general utilities for transforming and optimizing queries as well as generating build artifacts. A novel feature of the compiler is that it facilitates experimentation with new GraphQL features - in the form of custom directives - by making it easy to translate code using these directives into standard, spec-compliant GraphQL."]},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-36c8d6cd-dfa9-4139-ac2c-4a61ef7d2979.mdx",lineNumber:517,columnNumber:3},this),(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.li,{children:[(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.em,{children:"Relay Runtime"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-36c8d6cd-dfa9-4139-ac2c-4a61ef7d2979.mdx",lineNumber:518,columnNumber:5},this),': A full-featured, high-performance GraphQL runtime that can be used to build higher-level client APIs. The runtime features a normalized object cache, optimized "write" and "read" operations, a generic abstraction for incrementally fetching field data (such as for pagination), garbage collection for removing unreferenced cache entries, optimistic mutations with arbitrary logic, support for building subscriptions and live queries, and more.']},void 0,!0,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-36c8d6cd-dfa9-4139-ac2c-4a61ef7d2979.mdx",lineNumber:518,columnNumber:3},this),(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.li,{children:[(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.em,{children:"React/Relay"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-36c8d6cd-dfa9-4139-ac2c-4a61ef7d2979.mdx",lineNumber:519,columnNumber:5},this),": A high-level product API that integrates the Relay Runtime with React. end of this comprehensive guide, you will learn how to use Apollo Client to fetch data from a GraphQL server. Apollo is a gold standard between the GraphQL ecosystem and React. It's simple, powerful, and flexible. It has a lot of features for modern applications. The downside is the bigger size of the library. It is not convenient to use this "mega" library for a simple application. Apollo is a platform-agnostic client. It can be used with any framework on the client-side, as well as with vanilla JavaScript. Works well with TypeScript and serverless architectures. Works well with Node.js and supports many libraries.`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-36c8d6cd-dfa9-4139-ac2c-4a61ef7d2979.mdx",lineNumber:669,columnNumber:1},this),(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.p,{children:"Installation:"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-36c8d6cd-dfa9-4139-ac2c-4a61ef7d2979.mdx",lineNumber:673,columnNumber:1},this),(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.pre,{className:"language-js",children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.code,{className:"language-js code-highlight",children:(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.span,{className:"code-line",children:["npm install @apollo",(0,n.jsxDEV)(e.span,{className:"token operator",children:"/"},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/home/drago/Documents/MyProjects/noviblogmdx1/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-36c8d6cd-dfa9-4139-ac2c-4a61ef7d2979.mdx",lineNumber:1,columnNumber:1},this),`client graphql

My focus is on the protocol-specific GraphQL clients. The GraphQL clients presented in this post, are all pretty solid and have a lot of good features. You can find a lot of comparison tables and examples of how to use the GraphQL clients on the internet. But this post aims to show you practical examples, with the same query and different GraphQL clients.
